Key Match Events: Tristan da Silva scored 25 points, and Goga Bitzade contributed 11 points and 13 rebounds
The Orlando Magic defeated the Toronto Raptors 106-97
Toronto's winning streak was stopped at one, dropping them to 8-27 on the season
Pre-Game Insights: The Raptors were at full strength other than RJ Barrett, who was held out due to illness
The Magic had the NBA's third-rated defence and were fourth in the East
The Raptors' defence struggled, particularly in the first half
Cory Joseph had one of his best games against his old team, scoring 11 points and making 3-of-5 threes
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic look like they've found another nice player in rookie Tristan da Silva
The Raptors should take note of the Magic's success as a blueprint for their rebuild
The Magic's depth has made it challenging for Caleb Houstan to carve out regular rotation minutes, but he has earned fans for his work ethic and professionalism
Jamal Shead has emerged as Rajakovic's first choice off the bench at point guard when Quickley comes out
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jalen Suggs had to be taken off the floor in a wheelchair after diving to play a ball in the passing lane and hitting his lower back
Mo Wagner tore his ACL just before Christmas, ending his season
Paolo Banchero and Franz Wagner have both been out for extended periods with oblique tears
The Raptors' defence struggled, particularly in the first half, allowing rhythm shots
